property.tooltip: This is a shorthand property for setting both min-height and max-height.
Specifies the maximum height of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.
property.percentage: Refer to the height of the initial viewport

property.tooltip: Specifies the maximum width of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.
property.percentage: Refer to the width of the initial viewport

property.tooltip: Specifies the largest allowed zoom factor.

name.tooltip: The upper limit on zoom factor is UA dependant. There will be no maximum value constraint on the ‘zoom’ property used in the constraining procedure

number.tooltip: A positive number limiting the maximum value of the zoom factor.

percentage.tooltip: A positive percentage limiting the maximum value of the zoom factor.

property.tooltip: Specifies the minimum height of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.
property.percentage: Refer to the height of the initial viewport

property.tooltip: Specifies the minimum width of the viewport that is used to set the size of the initial containing block.
property.percentage: Refer to the width of the initial viewport

property.tooltip: Specifies the smallest allowed zoom factor.

name.tooltip: The lower limit on zoom factor is UA dependant. There will be no minimum value constraint on the ‘zoom’ property used in the constraining procedure

number.tooltip: A positive number limiting the minimum value of the zoom factor.

percentage.tooltip: A positive percentage limiting the minimum value of the zoom factor.

property.tooltip: This property is used to request that a document is displayed in portrait or landscape mode.

name.tooltip: The UA automatically chooses the orientation based on the device's normal mode of operation. The UA may choose to change the orientation of the presentation when the device is tilted.
The document should be locked to portrait presentation.
The document should be locked to landscape presentation.

property.tooltip: Overrides pixel size chosen by the UA.

name.tooltip: Use the UAs CSS pixel resolution.
Use device resolution as the CSS pixel resolution. That is, have a 1-1 relationship between a CSS and a device pixel.

resolution.tooltip: Set the CSS pixel resolution to a fixed dpi or dpcm value.

property.tooltip: Specifies if the zoom factor can be changed by user interaction or not.

name.tooltip: The user can interactively change the zoom factor.
The user cannot interactively change the zoom factor.

property.tooltip: This is a shorthand property for setting both min-width and max-width.
Specifies the initial zoom factor for the window or viewing area.

number.tooltip: A positive number used as a zoom factor. A factor of 1.0 means that no zooming is done. Values larger than 1.0 gives a zoomed-in effect and values smaller than 1.0 a zoomed-out effect.

percentage.tooltip: A positive percentage value used as a zoom factor. A factor of 100% means that no zooming is done. Values larger than 100% gives a zoomed-in effect and values smaller than 100% a zoomed-out effect.

name.tooltip: The used value is calculated from the other property values according to the constraining procedure.
The width of the screen in CSS pixels at zoom factor 1.0.
The height of the screen in CSS pixels at zoom factor 1.0.

length.tooltip: A positive absolute or relative length.

percentage.tooltip: Must be positive. A percentage value relative to the width or height of the initial viewport at zoom factor 1.0, for horizontal and vertical lengths respectively.
